verses.roman:
tatas te deva-yajanaṁ
brāhmaṇāḥ svarṇa-lāṅgalaiḥ
kṛṣṭvā tatra yathāmnāyaṁ
dīkṣayāṁ cakrire nṛpam

synonyms: tataḥ—then; te—they; deva-yajanam—the place for worshiping the demigods; brāhmaṇāḥ—the brāhmaṇas; svarṇa—gold; lāṅgalaiḥ—with plows; kṛṣṭvā—furrowing; tatra—there; yathā-āmnāyam—according to the standard authorities; dīkṣayām cakrire—they initiated; nṛpam—the King.
translation: The brāhmaṇa priests then plowed the sacrificial ground with golden plowshares and initiated King Yudhiṣṭhira for the sacrifice in accordance with the traditions set down by standard authorities.
